page.title: 12Lead toymaking in Rolvenden
page.content: {Mrs Newington}has been making lead toy soldiers and other lead models in Rolvenden for 12 years now. Her son bought some Victorian moulds in London and she began by helping him. Every stage is done by hand in her house in The Street. She begins by melting down lead pipework, pouring the molten lead into trays to make ingots. These in turn are melted down and the molten lead is poured into one of 150 different moulds. In a few moments the mould can be emptied and the long process of filing down and painting can begin. The making of these "toys" is a very dangerous operation. Mrs Newington spends no more than 1 hour each day at this and has regular check-ups for possible lead poisoning. She is able to sell all she makes without any difficulty.
